Articles.Content:
Tinkering around with aircraft, I came up with a fairly simple design with surprising versatility. Ladies and gents, the KF-101 Illusion.

DOWNLOAD: https://www./?hrne1i7iqc7m6ga

This download includes:

KF-101 - The default variant.

KF-101/ER - Extended range variant, with drop tanks. Be careful, it is very easy to pitch up or down too hard!

KF-101/SR - Short takeoff variant, with a "catapult" system to accelerate quickly.

KF-101/A - Armed with four underwing bombs, for target practice or blowin' stuff up.

KF-101/R - Docking port, for refuelling.

KF-101/X - Experimental variant, with a slightly slower roll rate, intended for studying the details of flight.

Enjoy your flight!
What's the err catapult system? Is it sepetrons or what?

What's the err catapult system? Is it sepetrons or what?

I too am curious about this!

Nice plane! Love the simple design.

I should point out though that an oxidiser-less T-800 is superior to two Mk1's. Maths to back me up:

T800: 360 units at 2.3 tonnes. Dry mass: 0.5 tonnes

2x MK 1 Fuselage stacked (Same length as a T800), has only 300 units at 2.2 tonnes. Dry mass: 0.7 tonnes

I believe that you get around 9-10 more minutes of thrust on jets.

Edited April 2, 2014 by Sgt. Cookie

@Cubed @guz, the catapult is a few seperatrons on a decoupler, which serves to both accelerate the thing and lift the nose for short runways or carriers. Tested with the KSc runway and a bat parts carrier, works pretty well.

@Cookie I did not realize that. The main consideration was most LF available, and jet fuselages tend to carry that. I'll experiment, thanks for the idea!

Also, I'm tinkering with a <Skillful> version - that'll be modded, but it will include rockets and a 30mm cannon. So far the stability and maneuvering haven't been affected, so looking good.
